div1.p: These papers relate to the promotion of Reed from Captain and Assistant Surgeon to Major and Surgeon. They are dated from August 22, 1893 to December 11, 1893. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Walter Reed, August 22, 1893

EXAMINING BOARD FOR PROMOTION

at Army Med. Museum,
Wash. D.C. Sept 9 ,1893.

Walter Reed
Capt. & Asst. Surgeon.

Record of proceedings of an examining board in
his case.
Found qualified and recommended for promotion.

Forwd Sept 11 '93, by the Surg
General, approving the
findings and recom-
mendation of the board.
J. O. G.

ADJUTANT GENL'S OFFICE,
RECEIVED
SEP 11 1893
-----
A. C. P. DIVISION.

Proceedings of a Board of
Officers convened pursuant to Par.
17, S. O. 192. C. S., War Dept., A. G. O.
before which on September 9, 1893,
Captain Walter Reed, Assistant Sur-
geon, U. S. Army, was examined for
promotion.

Charles H. Alden,
Col. and Asst. Surgeon General.
U. S. Army.

Joseph K. Corson,
Major and Surgeon,
U. S. Army.

ADJUTANT GENL'S OFFICE,
RECEIVED
SEP 11 1893
-----
A. C. P. DIVISIONAL.

Noted
D.D.B.

1st Endorsement
Surgeon General's Office
September 11, 1893.

Respectfully forwarded to the
Adjutant General of the Army,
approving the findings and
recommendation of the Board,

Surgeon General
U.S. Army

War Department,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
September 14, 1893

The finding of the examining board in this
case is approved, and Capt. Walter
Reed, Asst. Surgeon,
will be notified that his examination is satisfac-
tory.
BY ORDER OF THE SECRETARY OF WAR:
Adjutant General.
Notified by letter dated Sept. 14/93.
War Department, Washington, D.C.
September 9, 1893.

The Board met at 10 o'clock A. M., present
Colonel Charles H. Alden, Assistant Surgeon General.
Lieutenant Colonel William H. Forwood, Deputy Surgeon General.
Major Joseph K. Corson, Surgeon,
and proceeded with the examination of Captain Walter Reed, Assistant
Surgeon, U.S.A., who, having come before the Board and having heard
the order convening it read, was asked if he objected to be examined
by any member present; to which he replied in the negative.

The members of the Board were then, severally, duly sworn as
follows:

You do swear that you will faithfully and impartially examine and re-
port upon the candidate about to be examined,
and the Recorder as follows:

You do swear that you will faithfully and impartially examine and re-
port upon the candidate about to be examined and that you will faith-
fully record the proceedings of the Board.
The following letter was then read to the Board:

War Department,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE.
Washington, September 2, 1893.
Colonel Charles H. Alden,
Assistant Surgeon General, U.S. Army.
President Army Medical Board.
Surgeon General's Office, Washington, D. C.
Sir:

I have the honor to communicate to you, in compliance with
paragraph 18, S. O. 192, A.G.O. August 22, 1893, the following special
instructions concerning the examination of Captain Walter Reed.
assistant surgeon. for promotion to the grade of surgeon:
The physical examination should be thorough in character.

The professional examination will be confined to such clinical
experience as Captain Reed may have had since the date of his last
examination; due credit being given to the fact that he has already
passed successfully that examination.

Written questions and answers are not deemed necessary, but
the report of the Board should set forth briefly the separate clinical
items upon which the examination was based.

I enclose herewith the Personal History of Captain Reed, and
an extract from the Merit Roll of candidates found qualified by the
Army Medical Board at the time of his admission to the Medical Corps.

Very respectfully,
[Signed] Geo. M. Sternberg,
Surgeon General, U.S. Army.
under which special instructions the examination was conducted.

The following Papers from the Records of the Surgeon General's
Office were submitted, viz:
Merit Roll of candidate at examination for admission.
“Record of services, and efficiency.”
which were read and considered by the Board.

Captain Reed having signed the required certificate as follows:
viz:
Washington, D.C.
September 9, 1893.

I certify that, to the best of my knowledge and belief, I am
not suffering from any disease or disability which, in any way, in-
capacitates me from performing my duties as a medical officer of the
Army.

[Signed] Walter Reed.
Captain and Asst. Surgeon, U. S. Army.

the original of which is hereto appended marked “A”, the Board pro-
ceeded with the physical examination of Captain Reed and finds as
follows:
Vision, R. 20/xxx . L. 20/xx .

Slight Myopia and Astigmatism, right eye.
Hearing, normal.
Analysis of Urine.
Reaction, acid.
Specific Gravity, 1015.
Albumen, none.
Sugar, none.

Having found his physical condition satisfactory, the Board
then proceeded to examine the candidate upon his clinical experiences.
The subjects covered were:

Typhoid Fever.
Pneumonia.
Tuberculosis.
Gun Shot Wounds.
Antiseptic precautions in Surgical
Operations.
Malarial Fever.
the results of which examinations were satisfactory.

After due consideration we find that Captain Walter Reed,
Assistant Surgeon, U. S. A., has the physical, moral and professional
qualifications to perform efficiently all the duties of the grade to
which he will next be eligible and recommend his promotion thereto.

I concur with above finding
C. H. Alden
Colonel and Assistant Surgeon General.
U. S. Army.

I concur in the above finding
W. H. Forwood
Lieutenant Colonel and Deputy Surgeon General,
U. S. Army.

I concur in the above finding
Jos. K. Corson
Major and Surgeon,
U. S. Army.

There being no further business before it, the Board
thereupon adjourned sine die.

C. H. Alden
Colonel and Assistant Surgeon General,
U. S. Army.

Jos. K. Corson
Major and Surgeon,
U. S. Army.

Washington, D. C.
September 9, 1893.

I certify that, to the best of my knowledge and belief, I
am not suffering from any disease or disability which, in any way,
incapacitates me from performing my duties as a medical officer of
the Army.

Walter Reed
Captain and Asst. Surgeon, U. S. Army.

letter
Sept 14/93

Promoted to Maj & Surgeon 4 Dec., 1893.
Retired with rank of
Suspended from promotion one year from
, 189 ,by letter dated,

PROCEEDINGS OF A BOARD CONVENED PURSUANT TO THE FOLLOWING
ORDER, VIZ:

Special Orders, }
No. 192. }

HEADQUARTERS OF THE ARMY.
Adjutant General's Office.
Washington, August 22, 1893.
Extract.

17. Under the provisions of General Orders, No. 128, October 29,
1890, as amended by General Orders, No. 27, May 3, 1893, from this
office, a board of officers to consist of
Colonel Charles H. Alden, assistant surgeon general;
Lieutenant Colonel William H. Forwood, deputy surgeon general;
Major Joseph K. Corson, surgeon,
is, by direction of the Secretary of War, appointed to meet at the
Army Medical Museum Building, in this city, on Monday, September 4,
1893, for the examination of such officers as may be ordered before
it, with a view of determining their fitness for promotion, as con-
templated by the acts of Congress approved October 1, 1890, and July
27, 1892. The junior member will act as recorder.

The professional examinations will be conducted under special
instructions from the Surgeon General, through whom the reports of
the board will be forwarded to the Adjutant General of the Army.
By command of Major General Schofield:

R. Williams,
Adjutant General.

Official:
[Signed] Wm. J. Volkmar,
Assistant Adjutant General.

before which appeared Captain Walter Reed, Assistant Surgeon, U. S.
Army, in obedience to the following order:

Special Orders, }
No. 192. }

HEADQUARTERS OF THE ARMY,
Adjutant General's Office,
Washington, August 22, 1893.
Extract.

18. By direction of the Secretary of War the following named
officers will report in person to Colonel Charles H. Alden, assistant
surgeon general, president of the examining board appointed to meet
at the Army Medical Museum Building, in this city, on Monday, Septem-
ber 4, 1893, by Special Orders, No. 192, August 22, 1893, from this
office, at such time as they may be required by the board, for exam-
ination as to their fitness for promotion:
Captain Curtis E. Price, assistant surgeon.
Captain Edward T. Comegys, assistant surgeon.
Captain Walter Reed, assistant surgeon.
Captain James C. Merrill, assistant surgeon.

Upon the conclusion of their examinations Captains Price [now on
sick leave of absence] and Comegys will return to their proper sta-
tions.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.
By command of Major General Schofield:

R. Williams,
Adjutant General.

Official:
[Signed] Wm. J. Volkmar,
Assistant Adjutant General.

Recorded
3569 A. C. P., 1893.
War Department,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington City, September 14, 1893.
To Captain Walter Reed,
Assistant Surgeon, U. S. Army,
Washington, D.C.
(Hrs' the Surgeon General U. S. Army).
Sir:

The Board before which you were recently examined for
promotion has submitted a satisfactory report as to your qualifica-
tions. The record of the proceedings thereof having been approved
by the Secretary of War, you will be promoted to the grade to
which you will next be eligible whenever a vacancy occurs.
Very respectfully,
Assistant Adjutant General.

Subject: Assignment of Medical Officer.
U.G.A.
War Department,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, September 8, 1893.

Captain Walter Reed, assistant surgeon, U. S. Army,
having reported in compliance with paragraph 2, S. O. 133, A. G. O.,
July 7, 1893, is hereby assigned to duty in the Surgeon General's
Office as Curator of the Army Medical Museum, and will report in
person to Major John S. Billings, surgeon, U. S. Army, in charge
of the Museum and Library Division.
